programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: 75-year-young veteran actor J. Pat O'Malley takes a lesson from the "youngsters" by forming his own "oldster-trio" in a geriatric apartment commune.

programme.desc: Ben learns a patient's son is making advances toward his daughter. Susan has tickets to the opera.

programme.desc: Christian is seduced by an attractive friend of Edna's. In order to impress her, Jack represents himself as the manager of Cobb's.

programme.desc: It's contract negotiation time at Cobb's and after 12 years, Bannister feels he deserves a raise.

programme.desc: Although Edna wants the job herself, Bannister assigns Christian in charge of creating a store display.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Instead of spending the staff's money wisely, Bannister buys them a racehorse and enters it into a race the very next day.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Word of a new gold mine prompts Bannister to convince Edna to investigate their life savings.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Birthday girl Edna receives flowers from one of her high school sweethearts who want to see her again. Their reunion gets interrupted when a jealous Bannister shows up and learns they were actually married.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Jeffrey Brookes has a secret. His Uncle Bill is a free spirited "hobo" who has no interest in material things. To his horror, Bill shows up at his doorstep...but not before Stanley meets him and hires Bill to help around his place.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Running out of money, Stanley needs to take a job on the killing floor at his brother-in-law Hubert's meat packing plant. Later, his fortunes change when he learns Hubert is planning a secret trip to Acapulco with his secretary.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: When Stanley is being inattentive towards Helen, she decides to make him jealous by pretending to have an affair with the gardener. Both Anne and Jeffrey Brookes decide to help out and also hire some other guys to pose as Helen's lover.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.sub-title: And Who's Been Sleeping in My... ?
programme.desc: A young woman without a place to live has been sleeping in the Ropers' storage room. Stanley thinks the girl is a dangerous "dope fiend" while Helen wants to let her stay.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Ethel tries to get a china horse, supposedly from the Ming Dynasty, away from Helen.

programme.desc: Mr. Roper decides to fix Jenny up with Brookes' nephew and Brookes freaks out upon learning about it.

programme.desc: Helen's and David's birthday party is a disaster when first Stanley and Jeffrey and then Helen and Anne start squabbling.

programme.desc: Helen is convinced Stanley is having an affair when she sees him give a locket to another women.

programme.desc: Helen volunteers Stanley to babysit on his poker night.

programme.desc: Stanley fears Helen accidentally gave a box containing his girlie magazines to a church rummage sale.

programme.desc: Vicky's former boyfriend opens a seafood restaurant across from Jack's Bistro and makes Jack jealous.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack seeks advice from a psychologist about his recent impotence. Vicky thinks Jack is cheating on her with E.Z.'s girlfriend Susie.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack is asked to identify a counterfeiter, Mr. Bradford appears in the police lineup.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.desc: Jack and Vicky argue over money. Mr. Bradford offers to pay for sprinklers that Jack needs for the bistro if Jack can convince Vicky to marry him.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: With his ego bruised after to losing a trivia game to Vicky, Jack tries to best her but ends up embarrassing himself at a beach carnival in front of guests.
